data.title: 10 famous celebrities who live in New Jersey as of 2024
data.meta_description: Are you looking for celebrities who live in New Jersey as of 2024? Here is a list of some of the celebrities from New Jersey and what they do for a living.
data.text:
New Jersey is the home of numerous stars. From actors, athletes, musicians, and comedians. It is a special place where prominent personalities settle down or buy a second home. So who are these celebrities who live in New Jersey right now?

Several New Jersey cities are recognised as America's most expensive zip codes, and though the title shifts from one city to another, it tells a lot about the quality of homes in New Jersey. With sprawling estates, private pools, manicured lawns, and tennis courts, NJ's homes average several million dollars in cost.

New Jersey perfectly balances quiet, busy city life and suburban life. Cities such as Alpine are removed from the bustle of city life while still offering residents access to their best. So doesn't it create curiosity to check out celebrity homes in New Jersey?

Celebrities who live in New Jersey

Unsurprisingly, cities in New Jersey have attracted many celebrities over the years. Some beautiful towns sit on scenic sites with little public hustle. There are few commercial locations to disturb the peace of celebrities' homes in NJ; for instance, Alpine doesn't have a high school or a public mail service.

Celebrities here are sure to enjoy a quiet, uninterrupted life away from the limelight. Do you want to discover some of America's most familiar names that call this place home? Here are ten celebrity homes in New Jersey.

1. Bruce Springsteen

Born and raised in Long Branch town, NJ, the musician seems to be a proud New Jersey native as his house is in Rumson, NJ. The personality initially resided in the 7-acre estate from 1983 until March 2017, when he sold it for $3.2 million.

Fortunately for his tremendous fans, he still settled in NJ. Springsteen is the owner of a 368-acre horse stable and house located in Colts Neck. He is among the celebrities living in New Jersey as his primary residence.

2. Joe Pesci

Famous for his acting skills, Joe Pesci owns a modern-style bay-front home in Lavallette, NJ. The house is designed in an intriguing and unique style with only several corners on its exterior.

Besides having the side of the house facing the bay almost covered completely with windows, the sunsets over the bay are an absolute heavenly view. Moreover, one can see them without any obstruction inside the lovely house.

3. Eddie Murphy

The Beverly Hills Cop actor and renowned comedian have a lovely home in the Haworth-Alpine area of New Jersey. Appraised for voicing the Donkey on DreamWorks' Shrek, Murphy is easily recognisable across generations.

Born and raised in a Brooklyn neighbourhood in New York, Eddie enjoys the nostalgic residence in his Alpine home. While his current net worth is unknown, his track record indicates that the celeb is substantially wealthy.

He has amassed this from acting, singing, producing, and stand-up comedy. He also currently resides in a massive California mansion which is another testament to his wealth. However, Alpine makes it a nice quiet getaway.

4. Fabolous

Another Brooklyn-born celebrity, John David Jackson, is among America's most prolific rappers. Since high school in the early 2000s, Jackson's hit albums leave fans eager for more. The star keeps a lower profile due to past accusations and legal actions over domestic violence. However, the superstar is known to live among fellow hip-hop retirees in Alpine, New Jersey.

5. Chris Rock

Best known for his role in Beverly Hills Cops and Saturday Night Live comedy sketches, Chris Rock is also recognised for voicing zebra Marty in the Madagascar movies. In addition, rock has not only hosted his talk shows but has produced his sitcoms.

After a confusing onstage incident with Will Smith at the 2022 Academy Awards, Chris was said to have retreated from the spotlight by returning to his mansion in New Jersey. With several acres of well-manicured landscape and a massive personal pool, it's certainly a private haven for the superstar in Alpine.

6. Stevie Wonder

With an iconic blend of electronic instruments, the musician of various jazz and funk genres is credited with pioneering the R&B music of the 1970s. Although the superstar became blind shortly after his birth, it didn't stop him from rising onto the charts at a tender age.

He sings and plays the harmonica, melodica, piano, synthesiser, bongos, drums, congas, and clarinet. He remains one of the most iconic musicians in the nation today. The star has long been called Alpine home. However, rumour has it that he has plans to move.

7. Tracy Morgan

Alpine attracted yet another comedian who calls this beautiful New Jersey suburb his home. Building himself from humble beginnings, Tracy Morgan is known for his memorable roles on Saturday Night Live skits and his eponymous character in 30 Rock.

The personality has dealt with his health struggles, addictions and controversies for some time. Although he is open about generational struggles, Morgan honours his family's right to privacy from public scrutiny. The star splurged and bought a multi-million dollar brick mansion with a shark aquarium in Alpine and is currently living on the two-acre estate with his wife.

8. Lil Kim

An actress, rapper, model and tv personality, Lil Kim has ventured into various careers. Her real name is Kimberly Denise Jones. Queen Bee's house is located in Alpine, NJ, on the north side of Midtown Manhattan.

The house has several bedrooms and bathrooms on over 6,000 square feet. The single-family residential home was built in 1989, and the presence of lush green trees in the area accentuates its attractive and serene environment. The splendid mansion covers a 2.08-acre lot. Truly an awesome place to reside.

9. Mary Blige

A queen among Hip-Hop Soul musicians, Blige was discovered by Uptown Records in the early 90s. She was mentored by musicians like P Diddy, who also has a residence in Alpine, to produce some of her first albums.

Managing a name for herself as a musician, she broke into the film industry by playing supporting characters in various shows and movies. She became one of the first actresses to receive award nominations for music and acting within the same year. The superstar has a home in Alpine, New Jersey, but she is reportedly trying to sell the 8-bedroom, 13-bathroom mansion.

10. Wesley Snipes

Last but not least is another celebrity who calls New Jersey home. Beyond acting and film production, Wesley Snipes is a prominent martial artist. Legitimised by a black belt and an edgy stage presence, Snipes drives his fans wild by performing his stunts.

His film career has extended over the past several decades, although he faced some challenges. After fighting and losing the trial for tax evasion in 2008 and serving his time, Snipes returned home with a shifted perspective on the value of personal time with loved ones.

Snipes currently lives with his third wife in their massive alpine mansion. He plans on living a quiet life away from the media. The house is just one of several properties he owns and has garnered considerable attention due to its sprawling size.

Celebrities who live in New Jersey fast facts

Are there celebrities who live in Short Hills, NJ, in 2024? Yes. celebrities who live in Short Hills, NJ, in 2024 include Patti Stanger, Cory Schneider, Anne Hathaway and Richard Coogan.

Where do most celebrities reside in New Jersey? Most celebrities in New Jersey reside in Alpine, Saddle River, Cresskill, and Franklin Lakes.

What are some famous athletes who live in New Jersey today? Some famous athletes who live in New Jersey today include Don Bragg, Dennis Rodman, Carl Lewis, Joe Theismann and Carli Lloyd.

Which celebrities live in New Jersey right now? Celebrities who live in New Jersey right now are Chris Rock, CC Sabathia, and Kellyanne Conway.

Which places are you likely to spot celebrities in NJ? Places you are likely to spot celebrities in NJ include The mall at Short Hills, Stone Pony, Atlantic City, The W Hotel, Hoboken, and Alpine

Which celebrities have homes in New Jersey? Celebrities who have homes in New Jersey are Bruce Springsteen, Lil Kim, Jon Stewart, Chris Rock, Stephen Colbert, Ja Rule, and Missy Elliot

Which are the best professional athletes that were born in New Jersey? The best professional athletes that were born in New Jersey are Athing Mu, Amando Miguel, Bobby Ryan, Brad Brach, and Clark Harris.

Celebrities who live in New Jersey come in various forms. Actors, athletes, entrepreneurs, musicians, and rappers, among other prominent people, have a passion for Garden State. Is it because of the attractive environment of the cities? Alpine and other areas in Nj offer the best privacy for celebrities to escape the spotlight.

In the past, there has been an increase in Canadian actresses who have gained fame and left a mark on the entertainment scene. The prospect of seeing such talent on the big and small screens is a reminder that actresses from Canada are responsible for giving you more than just awesome hockey.
